definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: The revenue is derived from the following sources.
To recover the King's revenues was as important as to assert his prerogative.
sentences.chinese: 恢复英王的岁入同确保他的特权同等重要。

sentences.english: The government got much revenue from taxes last year.
sentences.chinese: 政府去年通过税收获得了大量岁入。

sentences.english: However, tariffs and custom duties, which were significant sources of revenue dried up.
sentences.chinese: 然而作为国家重要岁入来源的关税却因此被榨干。

definition: to be orphaned of one's father
family livelihood/a household's economic situation/family property
unit of area equal to 100 畝|亩[mu3] or 6.67 hectares/a short while/a little while ago/circa. (for approximate dates)
to attend (a school)/to drop out (of college etc)
method of calculating a person's age in years from birth/see also 虛歲|虚岁[xu1 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
ten thousand strings of cash/very wealthy/millionaire
to remove or lighten (a tax etc)
